definitions: simple house or shelter made of wood typically in rural areas
private room or compartment on a ship for passengers or crew
enclosed compartment for passengers or crew in an aircraft
examples: They spent the weekend at their mountain cabin overlooking the lake
The old log cabin had been in the family for generations
The cruise ship cabin had a balcony with ocean views
First-class passengers enjoyed spacious cabins with private bathrooms
The flight attendant walked through the cabin checking seatbelts
Cabin pressure dropped suddenly during the turbulent flight

definitions: piece of furniture with shelves or drawers for storing or displaying items
group of senior government ministers who advise and make policy decisions
private room used for meetings or displaying collections
examples: She stored the china in the dining room cabinet
The medicine cabinet needed to be locked for child safety
The president met with his cabinet to discuss foreign policy
Several cabinet members resigned following the scandal
The doctor's cabinet contained rare medical instruments
They retired to the cabinet for private discussions

definitions: skilled craftsperson who designs and builds fine furniture especially cabinets
examples: The cabinetmaker spent months creating the custom kitchen
My grandfather was a master cabinetmaker trained in traditional methods

definitions: thick strong rope or steel wire used for construction or support
insulated wire or wires for transmitting electricity or signals
message sent by telegraph especially internationally in the past
television broadcasting system transmitted through coaxial or fiber cables
examples: The suspension bridge was held up by massive steel cables
They used cables to tow the broken-down vehicle
The electrician ran new cables through the walls
Fiber optic cables carry internet data at high speeds
He sent a cable to announce his safe arrival
The urgent cable arrived from the embassy
We switched from satellite to cable for better reception
Cable television offers hundreds of channels

definitions: railroad car attached at the end of freight trains for crew use
examples: The conductor rode in the red caboose at the train's end
Children waved at the caboose as the freight train passed

definitions: automobile with a roof that can be folded back or removed
light two-wheeled horse-drawn carriage with a folding hood
examples: She drove her new cabriolet with the top down on sunny days
The luxury cabriolet featured a retractable hardtop
The Victorian couple rode through the park in a cabriolet
Historical paintings often depicted elegant cabriolets

definitions: tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America
seeds from the cacao tree used to make chocolate and cocoa
examples: Cacao trees thrive in the humid rainforest climate
The plantation grew cacao for the chocolate industry
Raw cacao beans have a bitter taste before processing
They import cacao from West African countries

definitions: hidden storage place for provisions, weapons, or valuable items
temporary storage area in computer systems for frequently accessed data
examples: The explorers discovered a cache of supplies in the cave
Pirates buried their cache of treasure on the island
Clearing your browser cache can improve performance
The processor cache speeds up data retrieval

definitions: quality of being respected, admired, or having prestige and distinction
official seal or mark on a document showing authenticity
examples: The designer label gave the product extra cachet
Working at that firm carries considerable cachet
The document bore the official cachet of the embassy
Historical letters often featured wax cachets

definitions: harsh discordant mixture of sounds that is unpleasant to hear
examples: The cacophony of car horns filled the busy intersection
A cacophony of voices erupted when the announcement was made

definitions: man who behaves dishonorably especially toward women
examples: He proved himself a cad by breaking his promises
Victorian novels often featured cads as villains

definitions: dead human body especially one used for medical study or dissection
examples: Medical students studied anatomy using preserved cadavers
The cadaver was donated to science for research purposes

definitions: person who carries golf clubs and assists players during a game
examples: The professional golfer's caddie advised on club selection
She worked as a caddie at the country club during summers

definitions: small container or holder used for storing or organizing items
examples: She kept her tea bags in a decorative caddy
The desk caddy held pens and office supplies neatly

definitions: rhythmic flow or pattern of sounds in music or speech
rise and fall in pitch of voice especially at phrase endings
examples: The marching band maintained a steady cadence
The poem's cadence created a hypnotic effect
Her speech had the distinctive cadence of the southern dialect
The preacher's cadence rose and fell dramatically

definitions: elaborate virtuoso solo passage in a concerto allowing performer to display skill
examples: The violinist's cadenza brought the audience to their feet
Mozart wrote optional cadenzas for his piano concertos

definitions: student training to become an officer in military or police service
younger son or brother in a family traditionally
examples: The cadet graduated from the military academy with honors
Police cadets undergo rigorous physical and mental training
As the cadet branch of the family, they inherited less
The cadet son pursued a military career

definitions: soft bluish-white metallic chemical element used in batteries and pigments
examples: Cadmium batteries are being phased out due to toxicity concerns
Artists once used cadmium yellow pigments in their paintings

definitions: small group of people specially trained for a particular purpose or profession
permanent nucleus of trained military personnel around which larger unit forms
examples: A cadre of experienced teachers mentored the new staff
The revolutionary cadre planned the uprising carefully
The military cadre trained recruits for combat
Each battalion maintained a cadre of veteran officers

definitions: surgical procedure to deliver a baby through incisions in the abdomen and uterus
examples: The doctor recommended a caesarean due to complications
Emergency caesarean sections save many lives during difficult births

definitions: soft silvery-gold alkali metal element used in atomic clocks
examples: Caesium atomic clocks provide extremely accurate time measurements
The caesium isotope is used in medical imaging

definitions: small informal restaurant serving light meals and beverages especially coffee
examples: They met at the corner cafe for morning coffee
The sidewalk cafe offered outdoor seating with city views

definitions: restaurant where customers serve themselves from counters and carry food to tables
examples: Students ate lunch in the school cafeteria every day
The hospital cafeteria served meals to staff and visitors

definitions: bitter alkaloid substance found in coffee and tea that stimulates the central nervous system
examples: Too much caffeine can cause jitters and insomnia
She reduced her caffeine intake to improve sleep quality

definitions: structure of bars or wires for confining birds or animals
framework structure that surrounds or protects something
examples: The parakeet sang happily in its ornate cage
Zoo animals should have cages that mimic natural habitats
The roll cage protected the race car driver during crashes
Safety cages surround dangerous machinery in factories

definitions: crocodilian reptile native to Central and South American wetlands
examples: The caiman lurked beneath the murky river surface
Caimans are smaller than their alligator and crocodile relatives

definitions: mound of stones built as memorial or landmark especially on mountain trails
examples: Hikers added stones to the cairn marking the summit
Ancient cairns marked burial sites across the moorland

definitions: watertight chamber used in underwater construction work or bridge foundations
two-wheeled military vehicle for transporting ammunition
examples: Workers descended into the caisson to build the bridge pier
The caisson kept water out during underwater construction
Artillery units used caissons to transport shells to the front
Historic caissons are displayed in military museums

definitions: sweet baked food made from flour, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients
compressed solid mass of a particular substance
examples: She baked a chocolate cake for the birthday party
The wedding cake had three tiers with white frosting
The mud dried into hard cakes in the sun
A cake of soap sat by the washbasin

definitions: large gourd fruit that grows on tropical vines or trees
container or vessel made from the dried shell of a calabash
examples: The calabash vine produced several large fruits
Wild calabash trees grow throughout the Caribbean
Musicians played instruments made from decorated calabashes
They used calabash bowls to serve the traditional meal

definitions: event causing great damage, distress, or misfortune affecting many people
examples: The earthquake was a calamity that left thousands homeless
Financial calamity struck when the stock market crashed

definitions: process by which organic tissue becomes hardened by calcium salt deposits
examples: Arterial calcification increases the risk of heart disease
X-rays revealed calcification in the patient's shoulder joint

definitions: common crystalline form of calcium carbonate found in limestone and marble
examples: The cave walls sparkled with calcite crystal formations
Geologists identified calcite deposits in the rock samples

definitions: soft gray alkaline earth metal essential for bones and biological functions
examples: Dairy products provide calcium for strong bones and teeth
The doctor prescribed calcium supplements for osteoporosis prevention

definitions: process of using mathematics to find an answer or solve a problem
careful planning or forethought especially to achieve a specific goal
examples: Her calculation showed the project would exceed budget
Complex calculations are needed to predict weather patterns
His every move showed careful calculation and strategy
The politician's calculation proved correct in winning votes

definitions: electronic device used for performing mathematical calculations
examples: Students used calculators during the mathematics exam
The accountant's calculator displayed the quarterly totals

definitions: large volcanic crater formed by major eruption and collapse of volcano mouth
examples: The caldera filled with water to form a crater lake
Yellowstone sits atop an enormous ancient caldera

definitions: system for organizing days into weeks, months, and years
chart or device showing days, weeks, and months of a particular year
examples: Different cultures use different calendar systems
The Gregorian calendar is used worldwide for business
She marked important dates on her wall calendar
The desktop calendar showed all upcoming appointments

definitions: young bovine animal especially a domestic cow under one year old
fleshy muscular back part of the leg below the knee
examples: The calf stayed close to its mother in the pasture
Dairy farmers separate calves from cows after birth
She stretched her calf muscles before running
The injury to his calf kept him from playing

definitions: internal diameter of a gun barrel or the diameter of a bullet
degree of quality, merit, or importance of someone or something
examples: The detective found a thirty-eight caliber bullet at the scene
Different caliber weapons leave distinctive markings
She hired only the highest caliber professionals
Athletes of his caliber rarely compete at local events

definitions: process of adjusting or checking instrument accuracy against a standard
examples: The scale required calibration to ensure accurate measurements
Regular calibration of medical equipment is mandatory

definitions: internal diameter of a gun barrel or the diameter of a bullet
degree of quality, merit, or importance of someone or something
examples: Police recovered a large calibre rifle from the scene
The antique pistol was a small calibre weapon
Writers of her calibre win international prizes
The university attracts students of exceptional calibre

definitions: plain white or printed cotton fabric originally from India
domestic cat with patches of different colors especially orange, black, and white
examples: She sewed curtains from cheerful calico fabric
Calico dresses were popular in pioneer times
The calico cat had distinctive orange and black patches
Most calico cats are female due to genetics

definitions: instrument with two adjustable legs for measuring thickness or diameter
metal support attached to the leg to assist with walking
examples: The engineer used calipers to measure the pipe diameter
Precision calipers can measure to thousandths of an inch
The child wore leg calipers after the surgery
Modern calipers are lighter than older metal braces

definitions: chief Muslim civil and religious ruler regarded as successor of Muhammad
examples: The caliph ruled the vast Islamic empire from Baghdad
Each caliph claimed legitimacy through connection to the Prophet

definitions: territorial jurisdiction or government under a caliph's rule
examples: The Abbasid Caliphate lasted for over five centuries
Multiple caliphates existed simultaneously during medieval times

definitions: loud cry or shout to attract attention or summon someone
telephone conversation or attempt to contact someone by phone
decision or judgment made by an official in sports or other contexts
brief visit or stop at a place
examples: They heard a call for help from the woods
The mother's call brought the children inside
She received an important call from her doctor
International calls can be expensive without a plan
The umpire's call was disputed by both teams
It was a tough call but she made the right decision
The ship made a call at several Caribbean ports
The doctor will make house calls for elderly patients

definitions: return telephone call or response to an earlier communication
second audition for performers who showed promise in initial tryout
examples: The manager promised a callback within twenty-four hours
Technical support will give you a callback when available
She got a callback for the lead role in the play
Only ten actors received callbacks after the first audition

definitions: person who makes a telephone call to someone
person who comes to visit someone at their home
examples: The caller hung up without leaving a message
Customer service agents handle dozens of callers daily
Unexpected callers arrived just as dinner was served
Victorian etiquette required leaving cards for callers

definitions: person skilled in decorative handwriting or lettering as an art form
examples: The calligrapher created beautiful wedding invitations by hand
Chinese calligraphers spend years perfecting their brushwork
